channel.title: How can noobs have 200 rep?
channel.description: Do people ++ reputation for bad commands like "What is java?"

item.title: How can noobs have 200 rep?
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:41, topic:382533”][quote author=Cole1497 link=topic=478326.msg3501316#msg3501316 date=1297742622]
You can get 200 rep by being an idiot and making lame jokes and insulting new people like me.
[/quote]
WHY DID THE CHICEEN CROSS TAH ROAD CUZ COAL IS A NEBFUG LOLOLOLO
REP++++ 4 HILARYUS JOK?[/quote]

How about warning++ ?

Anyway, I’m locking this topic for now. If anybody knows of any reason why it should stay open, please don’t hesitate to PM me.

Read full topic

[/quote]Hello ranger squad…[/quote]

You already told everyone on your other account that your name was James M.

Fail…

Most of the time its because people see “Noobs” doing better work then most of the older members (No offence) of this community.

item.title: How can noobs have 200 rep?
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“laurent 248, post:31, topic:382533”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=478326.msg3502675#msg3502675 date=1297873625]

Because reputation is useless, that’s why.

could you disable karma? plz. you said it’s useless sooo. just disable it.

or we can just leave it as it is and still no problem?
[/quote]

Damn right, people who care will care and people who don’t care wont care!
Anyway the “thanks” thing is just useless idiot, a joke, anything you want, there’s only 1 word changing and they will abuse too.[/quote]
No, it should only show how many times a person has been thanked on a post, not track a user’s total “thank count”. Otherwise it would be just like removing the rep limit

Read full topic

item.title: How can noobs have 200 rep?
item.dc:creator: @Stupit Stu
item.description:
@Stupit wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:4, topic:382533”]Thanking would be better. Rep is symbolic power, so to speak. Thanking is both polite and less desired to abuse.

Why would you want to thank someone 100 times in a spam post to get more “Thanks”? You wouldn’t, plus people would see who thanked who and take appropriate action if the post is an obvious waste of space.

I got my 200 rep posting a few tutorials. It’s easy to get if you contribute a little so has no meaningful value to me.

I occasionally have 199 and it’s funny because you can only -1 every time but max a + of 13. Doesn’t make sense.[/quote]
This man has sense. I agree 100%.

Read full topic

Because people don’t understand what reputation is for over here. Over at MITB, they understand it’s for good releases and being helpful. But here, people get rep for making jokes and being friends with people.
[/quote]
Rep at moparscape is now as useful as a inflatable anchor[/quote]
It never had a “use”
